Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 05:01PM aurabelle wrote: Hi Sally,  sounds like you and I are on the same page.  My surg. is Tues. 15th a bi-lat. and I've been in such a hurry to just get it over with, but in the last day or so all I can do is cry.  I've been prepared for this since Jan. and I like and trust my Dr. and even have plans in place for recons. but  for some reason now my emotions  have taken over.  I've been so logical and researched everything I can't believe I'm feeling this way.   Aurabelle
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 12:20PM aurabelle wrote: Thanks to all who have replied to my post, it's still very hard to know this will actually happen in 2 days.  But everytime I call my daughter to cry she listens intently then says "log on to your friends" and you all have certianly help.  Thanks as I go about my final preparations. Aurabelle
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2008 03:59PM aurabelle wrote: Hi everyone, it's good to be over my surg.  Had bi-lat mast. on 15th and all went well.  Very little pain and I came home the 16th.  Now I can rest for about a month and then on to reconst.   Can't begin to tell you all how much it has meant to me to have you here in the days leading up to surg. and good luck to all who are still waiting. Aurabelle
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 02:15AM aurabelle wrote: Hi all,  haven't posted here before, but am scheduled for bi-lat mast. on April 15th.  Thought I was ok until today, and could only look at hosp. pics of me breastfeeding my 5(now adult) kids and cry.  Guess I just needed to grieve.  I am greatful I was able to BF and that this didn't happen until I'm older and I do have the memories.
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: aurabelle wrote: 2 weeks out of Bi-lat mast. doing great, slight infect. with drains until removed and then a week of antibiotics.  Can do pretty much anything.  Last week surg. drained fluid and have an appt tomorrow and he will prob. drain again.  But why are my breast so hard?  I am almost larger than before surg. am uncomfortable but not really pain.  Due for reconst. in a month any help/answer appriciated.  Aurabelle Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: why is my masct. so hard? aurabelle AnneW
